usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script uses getViewport() during insertion to prompt the user for a viewport on a layout. It validates _Viewport.length() and retrieves the Viewport object to calculate Model Space to Paper Space transformations (ms2ps, ps2ms) and scale (dVpScale). It draws text, rectangles, and dimensions arranged in a grid based on the user-selected point (_Pt0) on the layout.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Layout (Paper Space) with a Viewport displaying an hsbCAD Element containing Sheets.

insertionFlow.promptOriginal: Select a point for first detail

options: Thickness not aligned with element thickness

opmProperties.description: The viewport scale will be used when the scale factor is set to zero.

contextMenu.action: Removes map data for current element if exists.

```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Generates a detailed 2D schedule of sheet elements (e.g., wall panels, roof sections) on a Paper Space layout, filtering for specific zones or alignments, and placing them in a grid with automatic dimensions and labels.",
    "category": "ShopDrawing / Detailing",
    "typicalUseCase": "Creating a specific layout page to detail and dimension kneewall panels, dormer cheeks, or other non-standard sheet components that are part of a larger element, filtering out standard horizontal/vertical sheets to focus on complex rotated ones."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sFilterAlignment",
      "technicalDefault": "No alignment filter",
      "businessMeaning": "Filters which sheets are included based on their orientation relative to the main element. 'Thickness not aligned...' excludes sheets that are flat relative to the element's main axes (e.g., excluding standard floor/ceiling panels to only show kneewalls).",
      "validRange": "Dropdown: No alignment filter, Thickness not aligned with element thickness",
      "unit": "Enumeration",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines which sheets from the 3D model are processed and drawn on the layout."
    },
    {
      "name": "nZn",
      "technicalDefault": 10,
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the construction zone to extract sheets from. Maps indices 6-10 to negative zones (-1 to -5) to allow selection of basement or roof zones.",
      "validRange": "0 to 10",
      "unit": "Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Filters the list of sheets based on the 'Zone' property assigned in the model."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBetweenSheetH",
      "technicalDefault": 100,
      "businessMeaning": "Defines the width (horizontal size) of the detail frame allocated for each sheet on the layout.",
      "validRange": "50 - 500",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the horizontal size of the rectangle frame and the drawing area for the sheet geometry."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBetweenSheetV",
      "technicalDefault": 100,
      "businessMeaning": "Defines the height (vertical size) of the detail frame allocated for each sheet on the layout.",
      "validRange": "50 - 500",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the vertical size of the rectangle frame and the drawing area for the sheet geometry."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBetweenVpH",
      "technicalDefault": 10,
      "businessMeaning": "The horizontal gap (spacing) between the detail frames in the grid.",
      "validRange": "0 - 50",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Controls the white space between columns of sheet details."
    },
    {
      "name": "dBetweenVpV",
      "technicalDefault": 10,
      "businessMeaning": "The vertical gap (spacing) between the detail frames in the grid.",
      "validRange": "0 - 50",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Controls the white space between rows of sheet details."
    },
    {
      "name": "nNrOfColumns",
      "technicalDefault": 3,
      "businessMeaning": "The number of sheet details to place horizontally before wrapping to the next row.",
      "validRange": "1 - 10",
      "unit": "Count",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the grid layout width."
    },
    {
      "name": "nNrOfRows",
      "technicalDefault": 3,
      "businessMeaning": "The maximum number of rows allowed for the sheet grid.",
      "validRange": "1 - 50",
      "unit": "Count",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the grid layout height. If sheets exceed this, a warning is issued."
    },
    {
      "name": "dScaleFctr",
      "technicalDefault": 1,
      "businessMeaning": "Controls the scale at which the sheet geometry is drawn inside the detail frame. A value of 0 forces the scale to match the source viewport's scale.",
      "validRange": "0 or > 0 (e.g., 0.5, 1, 2)",
      "unit": "Factor",
      "affectsOutput": "Zooms the sheet geometry in or out within the allocated frame."
    },
    {
      "name": "sDimStyleVp",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "The CAD dimension style used for labels inside the detail frame (e.g., Sheet Number).",
      "validRange": "Any valid Dimension Style name in the drawing",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Text height, arrow style, and font for sheet labels."
    },
    {
      "name": "sLayerNoPlot",
      "technicalDefault": "G-Anno-View",
      "businessMeaning": "The CAD layer on which the detail frames and non-critical text are drawn. Typically a layer that does not plot.",
      "validRange": "Any valid Layer name",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Layer assignment for the grid rectangles and sheet numbers."
    },
    {
      "name": "sShowSheetNumber",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the

workflowDiagram: Launch Script: User executes HSB_D-RotatedSheets.mcr
Insert Mode Detected (_bOnInsert == true): Script initializes for first run
Prompt for Viewport: User selects a viewport on the layout (getViewport)
Prompt for Origin: User selects a point for the first detail (getPoint)
Show Dialog: ShowDynamicDialog displays OPM properties if not shown before
Validate Viewport: Script checks if a valid viewport is linked to the instance
Validate Element: Script checks if the viewport contains a valid hsbCAD Element
Read Properties: Script reads OPM properties (Filters, Grid, Style, etc.)
Filter Sheets: Script iterates through all sheets in the Element
Check Zone: Discards sheets not matching the selected zone (nZn)
Check Alignment: Discards sheets aligned with element thickness if filter is active (using dot product)
Check Numbering: Discards sheets without a position number or duplicates
Collect Sheets: Aggregates unique sheets and counts quantities
Sort Sheets: Sorts the collected sheets alphabetically by position number
Calculate Grid Position: Determines row and column index for each sheet based on sort order
Check Map Storage: Looks for pre-existing position data in _Map (persistent storage)
Determine Position: Uses stored position if found, otherwise calculates default grid position
Draw Frame: Draws rectangle and text (Sheet Number/Material) in Paper Space
Create Transformation: Calculates Coordinate System (csSh2Vp) to project sheet geometry into the detail frame
Draw Geometry: Projects and draws sheet envelope onto the layout
Dimension Edges: Iterates sheet edges to draw dimensions (skips angled edges)
Draw Quantity: Adds quantity text (e.g., '2x') if count > 1
Store Grips: Adds the position point to _PtG array for drag/grip functionality
Save State: Updates _Map with the positions of all processed sheets

path1.name: Recalculate (Single)
steps: Check if map exists for current Element
Remove map entry for current Element
Force re-processing of sheets (grid positions reset if logic changes, but Map attempts to preserve if not removed)

path2.name: Recalculate All
steps: Force full reset for all elements in drawing

path1.name: No Alignment Filter
steps: Accept all sheets in the specified zone

path2.name: Filter Thickness Alignment
steps: Calculate dot product of Sheet Z vector and Element Z vector

path1.name: Stored Position (User moved)
steps: Retrieve point from _Map using Sheet Handle

path2.name: Auto Grid Position
steps: Calculate coordinate based on Origin + (Col * H_Spacing) - (Row * V_Spacing)

path1.name: Yes
steps: Map Sheet Y-axis to Viewport X-axis

path2.name: No
steps: Map negative Sheet Y-axis to Viewport X-axis

validationRules.recovery: Script erases itself if no viewport is found attached to the instance.
Script returns early if the viewport does not contain a valid hsbCAD Element.
Skips any sheet without a valid position number (posNum == -1) or duplicates.

validationRules.errorMessage: Not all sheets are placed! Increase the amount of rows and/or columns!
validationRules.recovery: User must increase 'Number of rows' (nNrOfRows) or 'Number of columns' (nNrOfColumns) in properties to accommodate all filtered sheets.
Script prevents action if user drags a non-existent or invalid grip point.

postInsertionActions.how: Grip Edit (Drag handle on sheet detail)
postInsertionActions.effect: Updates the specific sheet's position in the _Map storage. The sheet stays at the new location even after recalculation.

postInsertionActions.how: OPM Properties (Grid: Spacing, Rows/Cols; Style: Layers, Scale; Selection: Filters)
postInsertionActions.effect: Triggers immediate recalculation. Grid arrangement updates, filtered sheets appear/disappear, styles change. Positions of moved sheets are preserved via Map unless 'Recalculate' is triggered.
Clears the stored position data for the current Element, causing sheets to snap back to the automatically calculated grid positions.
Clears all stored map data for all instances in the drawing.

data.markdown:
# HSB_D-RotatedSheets.mcr

## Overview
This script generates a detailed 2D schedule of sheet elements (such as wall panels or roof sections) on a Paper Space layout. It arranges the sheets in a customizable grid with automatic dimensions, labels, and geometry views, filtering by specific zones or orientations to focus on non-standard or rotated components.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | No | This script is designed for Paper Space layouts only. |
| Paper Space | Yes | This is the primary workspace. Must be used on a layout tab containing a viewport of an hsbCAD Element. |
| Shop Drawing | No | This is a detailing/scheduling tool for layouts. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: An hsbCAD Element (containing Sheets) visible in a viewport on the current layout.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (This script works with Sheets/Element entities, not beams directly).
- **Required Settings**: None.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `HSB_D-RotatedSheets.mcr`

### Step 2: Select Viewport
```
Command Line: Select a viewport
Action: Click on the viewport in Paper Space that displays the 3D model/Element you wish to detail.
```

### Step 3: Set Origin Point
```
Command Line: Select a point for first detail
Action: Click on the layout to define the top-left (or origin) corner of the sheet grid.
```

### Step 4: Configure Properties
After insertion, select the script instance and open the **Properties Palette** (Ctrl+1) to adjust filters, grid spacing, and dimension styles.

## Properties Panel Parameters

### Selection
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Show only sheets with | dropdown | No alignment filter | Filters sheets based on orientation. Use "Thickness not aligned..." to exclude standard flat panels and only show rotated parts (e.g., kneewalls). |
| Draw sheets in zone | dropdown | 10 | Selects the construction zone (Index 0-10) to extract sheets from. |

### Grid
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Distance to next sheet (horizontal) | number | 100 | The width of the frame allocated for each sheet detail. |
| Distance to next sheet (vertical) | number | 100 | The height of the frame allocated for each sheet detail. |
| Distance to next viewport (horizontal) | number | 10 | The horizontal gap between sheet details in the grid. |
| Distance to next viewport (vertical) | number | 10 | The vertical gap between sheet details in the grid. |
| Number of columns | number | 3 | The number of sheet details placed horizontally before wrapping to the next row. |
| Number of rows | number | 3 | The maximum number of rows allowed for the grid. |

### Viewport Style
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Scale factor | number | 1 | Scale of the sheet geometry inside the frame. Set to 0 to match the source viewport's scale. |
| Dimension style viewport | dropdown | *Empty* | The CAD dimension style used for labels inside the detail frame. |
| No-plot layer name | text | G-Anno-View | The layer assigned to the grid rectangles and non-critical text (typically a non-plotting layer). |
| Show sheet number | dropdown | Yes | Toggles the visibility of the sheet number label. |
| Columns | dropdown | Left to right | Determines the direction in which columns are filled. |
| Swap sheet | dropdown | No | Swaps the orientation of the sheet geometry projection (Rotates 90 degrees). |

### Measurements
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Dimension style | dropdown | *Empty* | The CAD dimension style used for the overall dimensions of the sheet. |
| Offset edge dimension | number | 100 | The offset distance for dimension lines from the sheet geometry. |
| Show material | dropdown | Yes | Toggles the visibility of the material label. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Recalculate | Resets the positions of sheets for the current Element, snapping them back to the automatic grid layout. Use this if you want to undo manual movements. |
| Recalculate All | Clears all stored position data for all instances of this script in the drawing, resetting everything to default. |

## Settings Files
None required.

## Tips
- **Manual Adjustment**: You can click and drag individual sheet details to move them manually. The script remembers these positions even after recalculation.
- **Filtering Complex Parts**: To create a schedule for only kneewalls or dormer cheeks, set "Show only sheets with" to "Thickness not aligned with element thickness".
- **Capacity Warnings**: If you see a warning that not all sheets are placed, increase the "Number of rows" or "Number of columns" in the Grid properties.
- **Resetting Layout**: If the layout becomes messy, right-click the script instance and select "Recalculate" to snap all sheets back to a clean grid.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why are my standard floor panels missing?**
  A: Check the "Show only sheets with" property. If "Thickness not aligned..." is selected, standard panels parallel to the element axes are filtered out.
- **Q: How do I change the scale of the details?**
  A: Adjust the "Scale factor" property in the Viewport Style category.
- **Q: The grid runs off the page. How do I fix it?**
  A: You can either decrease the "Distance to next sheet" (frame size) values or increase the "Number of rows/columns" and change the "Columns" direction to wrap the grid differently.
